intro: Ludwigia apetala, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as marshes and wetlands. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and can vary in color from green to reddish. Ludwigia apetala is popular in water gardens and pond landscapes due to its ornamental value.
